Nav victims demand the departure of Hauglie and the Nav leadership
Confidence is gone. Both Anniken Hauglie and the Nav leadership should step down, believes Nav victims who attend Hauglie's statement in the Storting on Tuesday.
05 Nov 2019, 21:23 by NTB



The leader of the AAP action Elisabeth Thoresen (center) and Rita Elisabeth Rudil√∏kken (center) during the Storting's report in connection with the social security scandal that sent innocents to prison. They believe both Anniken Hauglie and the Nav leadership must go. üì∑ Photo: Stian Lysberg Solum / NTB scanpix Gallery



We have no confidence in either Anniken Hauglie or the Nav leadership, says Rita Elisabeth Rudil√∏kken (t.v.) and the leader of the AAP action Elisabeth Thoresen after the report in the Storting in connection with the social security scandal that sent innocents to prison. üì∑ Photo: Stian Lysberg Solum / NTB scanpix Gallery


Several victims after the Nav scandal listened to Anniken Hauglie's (H) account of the case from the gallery at the Storting on Tuesday. Several were disappointed in the aftermath.
- I had expected to get an answer to why it has taken so long, but I don't think Hauglie gave a good answer, so it was not trusting, says Rita Elisabeth Rudil√∏kken to NTB.
- Lost everything
Rudil√∏kken was recovered close to NOK 200,000 by Nav after staying in Spain for a period while receiving work-clarification money.
- I lost my apartment, I lost everything. I was threatened with a police report, and I got mentally ill because I had a post-traumatic stress disorder from before, says Rudil√∏kken.
She believes that both the Labor Minister and the Nav management should step down.
- It becomes difficult to have confidence if the two are to continue. They have both spent far too long cleaning up, she says.
- Will be stamped
The same is true of the leader of the AAP action Elisabeth Thoresen. Among other things, the campaign is working to improve the National Insurance Act's rules on unemployment benefit (AAP).
- It's nice that she apologizes, but she can't ask for confidence. After such a scandal like this, it is impossible to trust either Anniken Hauglie or the management of Nav anymore, Thoresen believes.
Rita Elisabeth Rudil√∏kken says that although she thinks the tops must go, she does not hope that the issue of guilt will be the most important political issue going forward.
- The most important thing is to take care of those affected. For me, the most important thing is to get rid of shame, because you feel like a criminal, and it has been a burden in my life. You get labeled, she says.
